Plot Heatmap with Quantile Breaks

Source: R/AllGenerics.R, R/methods-plotQuantileHeatmap.R
plotQuantileHeatmap.Rd

Plot Heatmap with Quantile Breaks

plotQuantileHeatmap(object, ...)

# S4 method for matrix
plotQuantileHeatmap(object, n = 10L,
  annotationCol = NULL, clusterCols = TRUE, clusterRows = TRUE,
  showColnames = TRUE, showRownames = FALSE, legend = FALSE,
  color = viridis, legendColor = NULL, borderColor = NULL, title = NULL,
  ...)

# S4 method for dgCMatrix
plotQuantileHeatmap(object, n = 10L,
  annotationCol = NULL, clusterCols = TRUE, clusterRows = TRUE,
  showColnames = TRUE, showRownames = FALSE, legend = FALSE,
  color = viridis, legendColor = NULL, borderColor = NULL, title = NULL,
  ...)

# S4 method for dgTMatrix
plotQuantileHeatmap(object, n = 10L,
  annotationCol = NULL, clusterCols = TRUE, clusterRows = TRUE,
  showColnames = TRUE, showRownames = FALSE, legend = FALSE,
  color = viridis, legendColor = NULL, borderColor = NULL, title = NULL,
  ...)

# S4 method for SummarizedExperiment
plotQuantileHeatmap(object, ...)

Arguments

object

Object.
...

Passthrough arguments to pheatmap::pheatmap(). The names of the arguments must be formatted in camel case, not snake case.
n

The number of breaks to create.
annotationCol

Optional. data.frame that defines annotation mappings for the columns.
clusterCols

Logical determining if columns should be arranged with hierarchical clustering. Alternatively, can define an hclust object.
clusterRows

Logical determining if rows should be arranged with hierarchical clustering. Alternatively, can define an hclust object.
showColnames

Show column names.
showRownames

Show row names.
legend

Show the color legend.
color

Colors to use for plot. Defaults to the viridis() palette.
legendColor

Colors to use for legend labels. Defaults to the viridis() palette.
borderColor

Border color.
title

Optional. Plot title.

Value

Show heatmap and invisibly return a list of the components.

See also

Other Plot Heatmap Functions: plotCorrelationHeatmap, plotHeatmap

Examples

# SummarizedExperiment ====
plotQuantileHeatmap(rse_dds)

# matrix ====
mat <- assay(rse_dds)
plotQuantileHeatmap(mat)
